description: {"blocks":[{"key":"nt8m","text":"This protocol details steps to normalize the amount of protein for tryptic digestion in quantitative proteomic workflows by using a Biomek NX liquid handler system. It is optimized to normalize protein concentrations in a 96-well plate format and add TCEP, IAA, and trypsin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbf75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d442e","text":"This protocol works best as part of a semi-automated proteomic sample preparation workflow with:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfmjn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f19ur","text":"Automated Chloroform-Methanol Protein Extraction on the Biomek-FX Liquid Handler System","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":87}],"data":{}},{"key":"aete9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54p0s","text":"and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p90q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8reok","text":"Automated Protein Quantitation with the Biomek-FX liquid handler system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":71}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E52EC410BD7611EBB18D79939C85166B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/automated-chloroform-methanol-protein-extraction-o-bpfqmjmw"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EFCBBEF0BD7611EBB18D79939C85166B","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/automated-protein-quantitation-with-the-biomek-fx-bsyynfxw"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"ddv1c","text":"- A Beckman-Coulter Biomek NX-S8 or NXP liquid handler system with an 8-pod head is used for this protocol. Alternative liquid handlers can be used with appropriate method development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aocur","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"99sak","text":"- Because different deck orientations and system components are possible, you will need to modify the method file (attached in the 'Before start' section) for your specific Biomek liquid handler system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ed10u","text":"After measuring protein concentration by the DC (Detergent Compatible) protein assay (Bio-Rad), export protein concentration report through MD Spectramax 250 software that controls the microplate reader.
